definition: marriage arranged following a pregnancy/marriage necessitated by an unplanned pregnancy
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: My friend announced her shotgun wedding this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上我的朋友宣布她要奉子成婚。

sentences.english: It might lead to a shotgun wedding.
It's a real shotgun wedding for these two.
sentences.chinese: 这两个人是真正的奉子成婚。

sentences.english: It looks like it's a shotgun marriage for those two.
sentences.chinese: 看上去这两个人好像是奉子成婚。

sentences.english: I’ve heard that they had a shotgun wedding.
They are going to have shotgun marriage next week.
sentences.chinese: 他们下周要结婚了，是奉子成婚。

definition: to get married soon after meeting (abbr. for 閃電結婚|闪电结婚[shan3 dian4 jie2 hun1]) (neologism c. 2005)
to marry for the second time/second marriage/second spouse
to obtain a certificate or license etc/(PRC) to obtain a marriage license/to marry
to get married and have kids/to start a family
to get married soon after meeting
to give birth to a child or children
to get divorced shortly after marriage/to resign shortly after getting employed
